moves.4... Bb7 5. e5 Qe7 6. a3 Nc6 7. Be3 O-O-: paen trade opens the door to bishop attack
moves.12... dxe5 13. dxe5 Nxe5: trade knights to move the protective pawn
moves.14. Nxe5 fxe5 15. Bg5: black has to trade rook for bishop
moves.15... Qf7 16. Bxd8 Kxd8: taking bishop creates vulnerabillity with movement of bishop--check and a free piece
moves.17. Bxf5+ Ke8 18. Be4 c6: black declines trade but opens the door to more aggression
moves.19. Rad1 Be7: bishop protects d8 but not d7
moves.21. Qxb7 Qe8: defensive move with queen opens a door for bishop
moves.23. Qc8+ Kf7 24. Qxh8: at this point black has little left
moves.25... Kf5: followed by another attack on the queen
moves.26. Be8: best black can do is offer queen trade, and at this point, black can't afford trades
moves.26... Qh6 27. Ng3+: rescue knight with a check before queen trade
moves.29. Rfe1 Bf6: pawn at h5 vulnerable, then black bishop
moves.31. Nxf6 Kxf6 32. Re3 Kf5: rooks now aline to go after king
moves.33. Rde1 Kf4 34. Re3e4+ Kf5 35. Re4xe5+: not much left for black's fight
